subject: Management
title: When Someone Says No
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on When Someone Says No.

hook.text: A team member said 'I don't have capacity for this.' The manager froze.

buildup.text: Pushback on delegation can mean overload, lack of clarity, or fear of failure.

discovery.text: A 'no' is information. It tells you something about workload, skill, or motivation.

twist.text: Forcing the task anyway destroys trust. But always accepting a no removes accountability.

climax.text: Explore the reason, solve the real problem, then decide together how to move forward.

punchline.text: A no is the start of a conversation.

quiz.question: How should a manager respond when someone pushes back on a delegated task?
options: Explore the reason and solve the real problem
Insist the task must be done regardless
